description:
cant find anything wont open any of my books 
also there is no way to add local or edit the sources
Integrated and perfectly working!
Everything is gray (uncontrollable) except the CROSS (close button), so how to add books?

Nice interface. Presentation of ePub could use a little work, but it does the job.
My biggest complaint would have to be that it shows all Mobipocket e-books in the list, but attempting to open them results in being told that Books is only a preview and that they cannot be opened.
Does not seem to list any PDFs.
summary: Shows but does not work with .mobi books

description:
Lists .mobi files but is incapable of actually displaying their contents. Night mode doesn't change books to white-on-black, only changes app chrome (window border) to black. Most .epubs I have are shown as blank. Others are shown in a broken manner, and only very few are actually fully functional, despite these files working in other readers. No bookmark functionality, and the app seems to only remember which chapter a user is on, not where in the chapter the user is. Search sorting defaults to date, which makes no sense. Do I look at my books based on date, or based on title?

Overall, just a terrible experience. I would only use this if there were no other software available, but even then, it wouldn't be able to show most of my books.
summary: Unstable, featureless, limited ability to display ebooks

description: That what my version said when I attempted to read an ebook that it recognized. Message said operation not enabled because this is a preview version. Hence the 2 stars.
Not ready for prime time
Seems to not work. Says, no books found with not even an option to browse.

The interface, like many of the GNOME applications that adhere to the GNOME HIG, is excellent, but, this is where the usability of the application ends. GNOME Books does not adequately source files from different folders into the application, and faces challenges opening formats other than PDF. It has promise, but needs some attention from the GNOME developers to make it a truly useful application.
It can't open e-books with type epub: it hangs without any error information.
Seems like it could be good, but currently I can't see how to import my Books folder into Gnome Books.
App is in the mindset of GNOME: simple and efficient. However I regret that night mode doesn't invert pages colors and that position in each book isn't kept between openings.
It is necessary to activate the Gnome Tracker, but this consumes all my RAM and CPU just for search and read a book. It wold be perfect if the option to open ebooks from Files app exists.
summary: It works, but need more options

description: Exactly what I need. Just need a option to mark the finished books.
Why i can not open it?
No Books Found... Search shows nothing. Not a single button to import or even pull up a menu.
summary: Looks nice, but I can't figure out how to import books

description: Can not open document list for DBus ERROR, no .service found.
I do not understand how to import or open books (ePub, PDF) using this app.
summary: Interesting idea, but I can't use this app

description:
The interface like everything GNOME is slick as hell but the functionality is lacking. It didn't accept my PDFs, there's no display options beyond Night Mode (which is still great), and book management is a bit clunky.

With some TLC this app could be a wonderful replacement to the Apple Books app I use on my Mac, but until then one can dream.
There is no way you can open any book through this app. No open button.

1. Can not detect my ebook (epub,pdf) even on my documents folder!

The specific task was to find a Linux ebook reader which supports epub3, and it does. Some UI benefits, very few features, is reported to refuse to read any standard which can contain DRM.
lite and cpu friendly , works flawless and gets me best book reader !

description: I don't know about the other users complaining that they can't open from this application. I can - at least with the items it assumes are ebooks. It doesn't see most of them and I have 100s! I don't see anyway to add them manually, so this app must use meta generated from the indexer utility, I assume.
A good app to read my ePub editions.

As others have said; there's absolutely no clear way to catalogue and access books through this app. I've checked the (tiny) documentation and have found no comments about this behaviour or how to open/find files in general. It seems there's a critical bug making this application completely useless.
No way to open a book. The buttons do not respond.

I have tried this. At least it runs unlike Bukka and Bookworm (only available in Beta) Bukka coredumps without comment. Bookworm appears to be incompatible with later versions of Gtk. I am coming to the conclusion that as a community we do not read ebooks. As commented elsewhere there is no option to select a book or add it to a collection. suspect this could be a Gtk problem as well.

It reads epubs well showing me how far along I was in the book. I can increase and decrease the font easily. Best part is that it's completely free. Thanks developers for making an simple but elegant app.
That does nothing

I just wish it could remember which page we were in a book the last time and open the book on that page, cause it's a little annoying for heavy books like with thousand pages & navigating through the book with clicking on the blue parts(titles).

summary: try to install gnome-shell on your synaptic package installer

description: I can't open any file. It says collection is empty. Cannot drag and drop any epub file. not sure how this works.

I wonder WHY WHY WHY you people are writing "It looks on my documents folder" Ok... Did anyone created a symbolic link to the media and folder where you actually have your books? No? And what are you doing acting like google play users crying because of a terrible lack of knowledge using your installed system?

Yes, it will look in your "documents" folder. So just create a symbolic link on the same pointing to your library. PROBLEM SOLVED.

By the way: THE SAME APPLIES FOR GNOME MUSIC. Yes, it will search on the music folder. JUST CREATE A SYMLINK.

this is a great app. saves me a lot of time looking for books on my messy library. I can say that gnome documents is almost the same.
Same as others.
I like it very much

description: It auto detected my ebooks, but there is one problem that the epubs don't fit to your screen size they always have an extra paragraph that you have to scroll down in order to read in every page.
What's the point of an an ebooks app if it can't even import ebooks nor detect them?
I think it would help a lot if you gave us funcrionality like bookmarks, custom book icons and diffrent view layouts.
summary: It's a great app, but I would give 5 stars for more functionality

description: This app does not seem to have any of its features working (apart from open, close and about). Do not bother installing it. Go for Foliate - a full-featured ebook reader for Gnome.
Added books to documents folder, opened app, closed app, re-opened app - no books found on all attempts.
useless app, freeze immediatelly

If you get the icon in the middle of the screen which says "No Books Found" just click on the underlined link to the DOCUMENT directory below the icon. This opens a file browser window. Just browser to an ebook (or any pdf file for that matter) and click on it. You could also move ebooks to the Document directory, or put them in a subdirectory of Documents. I use if most to view all the equipment manuals on my system.
It needs the facility to change the folder where the books are kept.

To other reviewers saying they could not import their books, I put a symbolic link to my epub folder in Documents (ln -s ~/path/to/books ~/Documents/Books) and they all automatically show up in the app. 

I really like the simplicity of Books - Calibre is often overkill for my needs!
How can I open my local book in this?
summary: How can I open my local book in this?

description: constant loading of books and displays duplicates.
The application clearly states that it is useless and cannot open files.
Broken and abandoned
There is no option to set the view size
summary: Work well but the width size too large

description:
Like many GNOME Brand apps this is lacking features that you would expect. Bookmarks don't work. You cannot point the application to a specific folder. The ePUB renderer doesn't really work right, some text is overlaid on top of each other.

It's not terrible, but the problem is that Foliate exists and fits seamlessly into GNOME and follows the HIG. It also is feature rich compared to this program.

"No books found. Books from your Documents folder will appear here." And yet there are 39 ePub books in my Documents folder. Worthless. It's for simple reasons this that GNOME, and Linux in general, will never be usable by a common person until things like this are resolved. How hard can it be?

Like everyone else, i cannot open any epub. After you open the app there is no file only the message "Books from your Documents folder will apear here".
I have some epubs in ~/Documents/Books and nothing.
Also there is no option in right click to open with Books.
In the app there is no settings menu, no refresh, no setting that will let you choose the location of your books, no open file ... you have no options...
Someone said to make a simlink. Simlink to what and where dude? Give the complete info, don't speak in ridles.
I cannot find any guide on the webpage or the readme on github ... all of them are like the app. vague and with no explanations

i installed it and it is so simple to use that it had no settings. ONLY: no books showed up at all. And I cannot direct it to point to a folder... or index something... nothing. Just empty. DEVELOPER: you should probably look in to having some settings so that the app can be made to work if it does not... or better yet: make it just work.

People, you need to say which Distribution / OS & which version you're running before you give a review here at least. Not just for this application but for anything. Which install did you do? From your distribution's repo, or the Flatpak, snap? What Desktop environment/ window manager are you using? Be specific. What might not work on your system may work fine on another system.

It seems to be good, but what's going on with the path? It takes the books from Downloads instead of Documents and some books don't show up. Then, there is a fix on github apparently from 2 months ago, but this app hasn't been updated for 11 months now. Also, by doing a symbolic link doesn't work either.
Something is seriously broken with the version 3.26.1. The window just shows 'Found no books', and all controls are greyed out and unclickable.

description: It does not even launch. There appears a grey window with no controlls, no close button, nothing.

doesn't work in GNOME, i don't even know if it can open epub files, because the UI is greyed out after starting the application.

No tiene casi opciones, y las que tiene son inútiles. El modo nocturno sólo oscurece una pestaña desplegable, pero las páginas las deja igual. El texto se ve minúsculo y no se puede cambiar. Me gustó, por su sencilez, sin embargo, sugiero que haya opciones para modificar la tabla de colores (como en gedit), y opciones más fáciles para modificar el tamaño de la letra, los márgenes y el espaciado.

una lastima parece ser un exelente y bastante util pero le falta demaciado detalles una es pocas opciones para configurarlo y o saber siesta bien instalado juego al ajedrez y tengo bastantes libros en su mayoria pdf me quedo con Buka y bookworm me gustan los minimalistas porque Calibre tiene demaciadas opciones que no esta mal pero buka bookworm me parecen suficientes en tanto funcionen esperaremos a Gnomebook

description:
bref du gnome à l'état pur, à force de vouloir faire tellement simple cela en devient ridicule, par contre, gnome supprime des fonctionnalités intéressantes, et créé la frustration des utilisateurs.
Ne jamais recommander gnome, vos suppressions de fonctionnalités pourraient être fournies sous forme de plug-in, mais gnome ne sait pas ce qu'il veut
summary: Ne fonctionne pas, ni lit aucun livre

description:
Ce logiciel est encore jeune et il souffre de quelques défauts qui font qu'il n'est pas vraiment utilisable au quotidien, notamment la mise en page et la navigation en mode lecture, ainsi que l'absence de la possibilité de restreindre l'indexation des livres à un ou plusieurs répertoires donnés.

Du côté des points positifs, l'interface est claire et cohérente, et j'ai pu ouvrir tous les livres électroniques dont je dispose.

À surveiller...
Lire des ebooks ne demande pas des milliers de fonctionnalités, cette appli suffit donc, mais c'est un peu dommage que l'indexation soit 100% automatique.
Très belle application. Dommage qu'elle ne puisse pas ouvrir un fichier epub quand on clique dessus.

Les documents EPUB sont bien indexés mais il n'y pas de vignette générée:

Error creating thumbnail for foobar.epub Unrecognized image file format

En cliquant dessus, il y a juste des pages blanches affichées. Bref le logiciel ne fonctionne pas.

gnome-documents 3.22.1-1 sur Debian Stretch.
l'application fonctionne comme attendu : les fichiers epub sont indexés, listés & peuvent être lus. le mode nuit est pratique.
impossible d'en faire quoi que ce soit
Une application très utile, en plus développée par Gnome mais elle ne fonctionne pas sous Ubuntu 19.10. Quelle déception !
Ne fonctionne pas.

L'application semble simple et efficace.
En revanche elle ne permet pas de lire les livres protégés par DRM. Elle ne peut donc pas remplacer Adobe Digital Editions.
summary: Ne permet pas de lire les livres protégés
